text: In a program policy overhaul in defense where external regulators oversee work and escalations have been slow, what should the project manager do to define escalation paths and thresholds?

options.label: set clear triggers for schedule, cost, and risk escalation
handle escalations ad hoc each time
escalate every issue straight to the sponsor
hide issues to avoid escalation

explanation: Option a is correct because defined thresholds enable timely action. Option b is incorrect because ad hoc handling causes confusion. Option c is incorrect because over-escalation wastes sponsor time. Option d is incorrect because hidden issues worsen outcomes.

text: Given a agile clinical trial system in defense where multiple vendors are involved and steering committee meets soon, which action best supports define escalation paths and thresholds?

options.label: set thresholds so vague that no one uses them
document who to contact and how escalations flow
limit escalation paths to email chains only
handle escalations ad hoc each time

explanation: Option b is correct because clear paths prevent delays. Option a is incorrect because vague thresholds are ineffective. Option c is incorrect because single-channel paths can fail. Option d is incorrect because ad hoc handling causes confusion.
